definition: (of a bird, fish etc) to be caught in a net/(of a tennis ball) to hit the net/(of a criminal) to be captured
to fall or drop/(of the sun) to set/(of a tide) to go out/to lower/to decline or sink/to lag or fall behind/to fall onto/to rest with/to get or receive/to write down/whereabouts/settlement
colloquial reading for 落[luo4] in certain compounds
to leave out/to be missing/to leave behind or forget to bring/to lag or fall behind

sentences.english: And yet, the writing life continues to capture its victims.
sentences.chinese: 但是，写作的生活将继续捕捉爱好它的“落网之鱼”。

sentences.english: Perhaps he knew that, own iscaught instead is in kind of spiritual extricating.
sentences.chinese: 或许他知道，自己的落网反而是种精神上的解脱。

sentences.english: Under the Various European countries Police's force cooperation, Nepal fills is caught finally in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 在欧洲各国警方的强力合作下，尼塞终于在德国落网。

sentences.english: The crime netted the killer $17.00 and an old truck.
sentences.chinese: 落网的罪犯从中获得17美元和一辆旧卡车。

sentences.english: The public has the right to know the name and identity of the arrested.
sentences.chinese: 公众有权知道落网人士的名字和身分。

sentences.english: The fowler's pipe sounds sweet until the bird is caught.
sentences.chinese: 捕禽人笛声悠扬，直吹得鸟儿落网。

sentences.english: Six people have been arrested in connection with the kidnap and murder of a 13-year-old boy.
sentences.chinese: 六名涉嫌绑架撕票一名十三岁男童的疑犯落网。

definition: to fall into the net of justice (idiom); finally arrested
to bring to justice/to file away (a document)
to be at large (of a criminal)
escaped criminal/fugitive from the law (criminal suspect on the run)
It is hard to escape the dragnet of the law/the long arm of the law
